Description: Ostracon (?), large section of the upper-body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel (perhaps the same vessel as 70810) with base of one handle surviving, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is covered with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip, remains of four lines of red-painted Coptic text and a further line of red-painted cursive text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394884) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394884)
